decision_conditions: The Application does not demonstrate that the site is safe from flooding or that flood risk is suitably mitigated through the provision of an appropriate Flood Risk Assessment.  A Flood Risk Assessment is required in line with Policy EM6 in Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 1- Strategic Policies (Nov 2012); Draft Hillingdon Local Plan:Part Two - Development Management Polices with Modifications (March 2019) Policy DMEI 9; Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 Saved UDP Policy OE7; Policy 5.12 of the London Plan (March 2016); the National Planning Policy Framework (2019); and the Planning Practice Guidance (Flood Risk and Coastal Change March 2014).

The Application does not demonstrate that surface water run off can be controlled to ensure that the development would not increase the risk of flooding contrary to Policy EM6 in Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 1- Strategic Policies (Nov 2012); Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 Saved Unitary Development Plan Policy OE8; Draft Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Polices with Modifications (March 2019) Policy DMEI 10; Policies 5.12, 5.13 and 5.15 of the London Plan (March 2016); the National Planning Policy Framework (2019); and the Planning Practice Guidance (Flood Risk and Coastal Change March 2014).
description: Change of use from offices (Use Class B1a) to 10 residential units (Use Class C3)
